creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
description: PR hand in a loose fist and forearm with reflective metal disk on palm of hand; back of hand, top of fingers and wrist carved with horizontal bands of geometric and organic designs
text: This object probably functioned as a burial good, replicating in miniature the hammered-gold effigy hands often found in Moche and Chimú tombs. The figures and abstracted designs likely represent the type of tattooing seen on Peruvian mummies. The abstract forms had symbolic meanings, while the small figures on the hand represent people of high status.
title: Hand with Mirror
